A **yellow mold**, F, is a type of [monster](/wiki/Monster "Monster") that appears in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*. The yellow mold is a type of [mold](/wiki/Mold "Mold") that is [sessile](/wiki/Sessile "Sessile") and lacks limbs, eyes or a head like other molds.

A yellow mold has a [passive attack](/wiki/Passive_attack "Passive attack") that [stuns](/wiki/Stun "Stun") the attacker for some turns depending on the attacker's level, which can trigger when it is attacked in melee and not killed.[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)[\[2\]](#cite_note-2) Yellow molds possess [poison resistance](/wiki/Poison_resistance "Poison resistance").

A yellow mold [corpse](/wiki/Corpse "Corpse") is [poisonous](/wiki/Poisonous "Poisonous") to [eat](/wiki/Eat "Eat"). Eating a yellow mold corpse or [tin](/wiki/Tin "Tin") has a roughly 1⁄15 chance (7%) of granting poison resistance, and will always cause [hallucination](/wiki/Hallucination "Hallucination") when finished.

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Generation](#Generation)

- [2 Strategy](#Strategy)

- [3 History](#History)

- [4 Variants](#Variants)

  - [4.1 SLASH'EM](#SLASH.27EM)
  - [4.2 dNetHack](#dNetHack)
  - [4.3 xNetHack](#xNetHack)
  - [4.4 SpliceHack](#SpliceHack)
  - [4.5 SlashTHEM](#SlashTHEM)
  - [4.6 Hack'EM](#Hack.27EM)

- [5 Encyclopedia entry](#Encyclopedia_entry)

- [6 References](#References)

## Generation

Randomly generated yellow molds are always created hostile.

## Strategy

Yellow molds are not overtly dangerous for the [hero](/wiki/Hero "Hero") if they are attentive: attacking one carelessly in melee will cause them to be stunned for a while, and attempting to move while stunned risks the hero stepping into nearby [traps](/wiki/Trap "Trap") or attacking and even killing their [pet](/wiki/Pet "Pet"). Pets can be stunned by attacking a yellow mold as well, but due to how stunning works for monsters they will almost never remain stunned for long; pets with poison resistance can eat the corpse without worrying about hallucination or [confusion](/wiki/Confusion "Confusion"). Any [ranged attack](/wiki/Ranged_attack "Ranged attack") can also kill a yellow mold easily without risk.

## History

The yellow mold first appears in [NetHack 3.0.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.0.0 "NetHack 3.0.0").

## Variants

### SLASH'EM

In [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM"), yellow molds have a 9⁄10 chance of [reviving](/wiki/Reviving "Reviving") from their corpses like other non-[lichen](/wiki/Lichen "Lichen") fungi and molds.[\[3\]](#cite_note-3) A yellow mold has an overall 7.4% chance of generating from a corpse that reach 51 turns of age, is not [acidic](/wiki/Acidic "Acidic"), and is not located within or on top of a square of [water](/wiki/Water "Water"), [ice](/wiki/Ice "Ice") or [lava](/wiki/Lava "Lava").[\[4\]](#cite_note-4)[\[5\]](#cite_note-5)[\[6\]](#cite_note-6)[\[7\]](#cite_note-7)

Yellow molds can be generated in [fungus farms](/wiki/Fungus_farm "Fungus farm").

### dNetHack

In [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack"), [notdNetHack](/wiki/NotdNetHack "NotdNetHack") and [notnotdNetHack](/wiki/NotnotdNetHack "NotnotdNetHack"), yellow molds have a roughly 1% chance to grow from old corpses similar to SLASH'EM, and can revive from their own corpses.

### xNetHack

In [xNetHack](/wiki/XNetHack "XNetHack"), yellow molds and other fungi and molds take extra damage from [copper](/wiki/Copper "Copper") items, and similar to SLASH'EM they can grow from old corpses, though with much lower odds.

Yellow mold corpses can be used to brew [potions](/wiki/Potion "Potion") by [dipping](/wiki/Dipping "Dipping") them in [fruit juice](/wiki/Fruit_juice "Fruit juice"), which eventually turns the juice into a [potion of confusion](/wiki/Potion_of_confusion "Potion of confusion").

### SpliceHack

In [SpliceHack](/wiki/SpliceHack "SpliceHack"), yellow molds and other fungi and molds take extra damage from copper items, and similar to SLASH'EM they can grow from old corpses. A yellow mold can [grow up](/wiki/Grow_up "Grow up") into a [yellow moldier](/wiki/Yellow_moldier "Yellow moldier"), though this does not normally occur in gameplay.

### SlashTHEM

In [SlashTHEM](/wiki/SlashTHEM "SlashTHEM"), red molds are slightly less likely to generate from old corpses due to the addition of some new fungi and molds. All other SLASH'EM details apply.

### Hack'EM

In [Hack'EM](/wiki/Hack%27EM "Hack'EM"), yellow molds and other fungi and molds take extra damage from copper items, and similar to SLASH'EM they can grow from old corpses. As in SpliceHack, a yellow mold can grow up into a yellow moldier, though this does not normally occur in gameplay.

Similar to xNetHack, yellow mold corpses can be used to brew potions by dipping them in fruit juice, eventually producing a potion of confusion.

## Encyclopedia entry

Mold, multicellular organism of the division Fungi, typified  
by plant bodies composed of a network of cottony filaments.  
The colors of molds are due to spores borne on the filaments.  
Most molds are saprophytes. Some species (e.g., penicillium)  
are used in making cheese and antibiotics.

\[ The Concise Columbia Encyclopedia ]

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [src/uhitm.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 2936](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/uhitm.c#L2936): *stun passive against hero*
2. [↑](#cite_ref-2) [src/mhitm.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 1688](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/mhitm.c#L1688): *stun passive against monsters*
3. [↑](#cite_ref-3) [mkobj.c in SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2, line 764](/wiki/Source:SLASH%27EM_0.0.7E7F2/mkobj.c#line764 "Source:SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2/mkobj.c")
4. [↑](#cite_ref-4) [mkobj.c in SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2, line 765](/wiki/Source:SLASH%27EM_0.0.7E7F2/mkobj.c#line765 "Source:SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2/mkobj.c")
5. [↑](#cite_ref-5) [do.c in SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2, line 1685](/wiki/Source:SLASH%27EM_0.0.7E7F2/do.c#line1685 "Source:SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2/do.c")
6. [↑](#cite_ref-6) [mkobj.c in SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2, line 811](/wiki/Source:SLASH%27EM_0.0.7E7F2/mkobj.c#line811 "Source:SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2/mkobj.c")
7. [↑](#cite_ref-7) [do.c in SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2, line 1680](/wiki/Source:SLASH%27EM_0.0.7E7F2/do.c#line1680 "Source:SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2/do.c")

Base level 1
Base experience 8
Speed 0
Base AC 9
Base MR 0
Alignment 0 (neutral)
Frequency (by normal means) 2 (Quite rare)
Genocidable Yes
Weight 50
Nutritional value 30
Size Small
Resistances Poison

A yellow mold:

  • does not breathe.
  • cannot pick up items.
  • has no eyes.
  • has no limbs.
  • has no head.
  • is mindless.
  • is poisonous to eat.
  • does not eat. (*)
  • is neither male nor female.
  • is normally generated hostile.
Reference monst.c#line1306

A yellow mold, F, is a type of monster that appears in NetHack. The yellow mold is a type of mold that is sessile and lacks limbs, eyes or a head like other molds.

A yellow mold has a passive attack that stuns the attacker for some turns depending on the attacker's level, which can trigger when it is attacked in melee and not killed.[1][2] Yellow molds possess poison resistance.

A yellow mold corpse is poisonous to eat. Eating a yellow mold corpse or tin has a roughly 1⁄15 chance (7%) of granting poison resistance, and will always cause hallucination when finished.

Contents

  • 1 Generation
  • 2 Strategy
  • 3 History
  • 4 Variants
    • 4.1 SLASH'EM
    • 4.2 dNetHack
    • 4.3 xNetHack
    • 4.4 SpliceHack
    • 4.5 SlashTHEM
    • 4.6 Hack'EM
  • 5 Encyclopedia entry
  • 6 References

Generation

Randomly generated yellow molds are always created hostile.

Strategy

Yellow molds are not overtly dangerous for the hero if they are attentive: attacking one carelessly in melee will cause them to be stunned for a while, and attempting to move while stunned risks the hero stepping into nearby traps or attacking and even killing their pet. Pets can be stunned by attacking a yellow mold as well, but due to how stunning works for monsters they will almost never remain stunned for long; pets with poison resistance can eat the corpse without worrying about hallucination or confusion. Any ranged attack can also kill a yellow mold easily without risk.

History

The yellow mold first appears in NetHack 3.0.0.

Variants

SLASH'EM

In SLASH'EM, yellow molds have a 9⁄10 chance of reviving from their corpses like other non-lichen fungi and molds.[3] A yellow mold has an overall 7.4% chance of generating from a corpse that reach 51 turns of age, is not acidic, and is not located within or on top of a square of water, ice or lava.[4][5][6][7]

Yellow molds can be generated in fungus farms.

dNetHack

In dNetHack, notdNetHack and notnotdNetHack, yellow molds have a roughly 1% chance to grow from old corpses similar to SLASH'EM, and can revive from their own corpses.

xNetHack

In xNetHack, yellow molds and other fungi and molds take extra damage from copper items, and similar to SLASH'EM they can grow from old corpses, though with much lower odds.

Yellow mold corpses can be used to brew potions by dipping them in fruit juice, which eventually turns the juice into a potion of confusion.

SpliceHack

In SpliceHack, yellow molds and other fungi and molds take extra damage from copper items, and similar to SLASH'EM they can grow from old corpses. A yellow mold can grow up into a yellow moldier, though this does not normally occur in gameplay.

SlashTHEM

In SlashTHEM, red molds are slightly less likely to generate from old corpses due to the addition of some new fungi and molds. All other SLASH'EM details apply.

Hack'EM

In Hack'EM, yellow molds and other fungi and molds take extra damage from copper items, and similar to SLASH'EM they can grow from old corpses. As in SpliceHack, a yellow mold can grow up into a yellow moldier, though this does not normally occur in gameplay.

Similar to xNetHack, yellow mold corpses can be used to brew potions by dipping them in fruit juice, eventually producing a potion of confusion.

Encyclopedia entry

Mold, multicellular organism of the division Fungi, typified
by plant bodies composed of a network of cottony filaments.
The colors of molds are due to spores borne on the filaments.
Most molds are saprophytes. Some species (e.g., penicillium)
are used in making cheese and antibiotics.

[ The Concise Columbia Encyclopedia ]

A '''yellow mold''', {{monsym|yellow mold}}, is a type of [[monster]] that appears in ''[[NetHack]]''. The yellow mold is a type of [[mold]] that is [[sessile]] and lacks limbs, eyes or a head like other molds.

A yellow mold has a [[passive attack]] that [[stun]]s the attacker for some turns depending on the attacker's level, which can trigger when it is attacked in melee and not killed.{{refsrc|src/uhitm.c|2936|nethack=3.6.7|comment=stun passive against hero}}{{refsrc|src/mhitm.c|1688|nethack=3.6.7|comment=stun passive against monsters}} Yellow molds possess [[poison resistance]].

A yellow mold [[corpse]] is [[poisonous]] to [[eat]]. Eating a yellow mold corpse or [[tin]] has a roughly {{frac|15}} chance (7%) of granting poison resistance, and will always cause [[hallucination]] when finished.

==Generation==
Randomly generated yellow molds are always created hostile.

==Strategy==
Yellow molds are not overtly dangerous for the [[hero]] if they are attentive: attacking one carelessly in melee will cause them to be stunned for a while, and attempting to move while stunned risks the hero stepping into nearby [[trap]]s or attacking and even killing their [[pet]]. Pets can be stunned by attacking a yellow mold as well, but due to how stunning works for monsters they will almost never remain stunned for long; pets with poison resistance can eat the corpse without worrying about hallucination or [[confusion]]. Any [[ranged attack]] can also kill a yellow mold easily without risk.

==History==
The yellow mold first appears in [[NetHack 3.0.0]].

==Variants==
===SLASH'EM===
In [[SLASH'EM]], yellow molds have a {{frac|9|10}} chance of [[reviving]] from their corpses like other non-[[lichen]] fungi and molds.{{refsrc|mkobj.c|764|version=SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2}} A yellow mold has an overall 7.4% chance of generating from a corpse that reach 51 turns of age, is not [[acidic]], and is not located within or on top of a square of [[water]], [[ice]] or [[lava]].{{refsrc|mkobj.c|765|version=SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2}}{{refsrc|do.c|1685|version=SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2}}{{refsrc|mkobj.c|811|version=SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2}}{{refsrc|do.c|1680|version=SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2}}

Yellow molds can be generated in [[fungus farm]]s.

===dNetHack===
In [[dNetHack]], [[notdNetHack]] and [[notnotdNetHack]], yellow molds have a roughly 1% chance to grow from old corpses similar to SLASH'EM, and can revive from their own corpses.

===xNetHack===
In [[xNetHack]], yellow molds and other fungi and molds take extra damage from [[copper]] items, and similar to SLASH'EM they can grow from old corpses, though with much lower odds.

Yellow mold corpses can be used to brew [[potion]]s by [[dipping]] them in [[fruit juice]], which eventually turns the juice into a [[potion of confusion]].

===SpliceHack===
In [[SpliceHack]], yellow molds and other fungi and molds take extra damage from copper items, and similar to SLASH'EM they can grow from old corpses. A yellow mold can [[grow up]] into a [[yellow moldier]], though this does not normally occur in gameplay.

===SlashTHEM===
In [[SlashTHEM]], red molds are slightly less likely to generate from old corpses due to the addition of some new fungi and molds. All other SLASH'EM details apply.

===Hack'EM===
In [[Hack'EM]], yellow molds and other fungi and molds take extra damage from copper items, and similar to SLASH'EM they can grow from old corpses. As in SpliceHack, a yellow mold can grow up into a yellow moldier, though this does not normally occur in gameplay.

Similar to xNetHack, yellow mold corpses can be used to brew potions by dipping them in fruit juice, eventually producing a potion of confusion.
